intro: Shawia candidissima, commonly known as the white-flowered shawia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs, while its stems are woody and somewhat succulent. Shawia candidissima is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
